Actually register may be fine alone
This is fine, but I'd advise Objects.requireNonNull or preconditions.
Yes, for these illegal states use objects check

Null check
Assertion errors please. Also specify in message something like Untransformed Accessor or This shouldn't happen
Fully capitalized name, this is a static final field.

nodes.bodyText: Validate parameters as not null.
Javadoc please. Describe what each method in the builder does and which methods are required. I'd advise including a code example in class javadoc to show how to use this builder.
Since constructor is private, I'd make this class final or make the constructor protected.
Is there a vanilla structure builder? If not I may consifer omitting Fabric from the class name, but player and liach may have different opinions about that.
I'll keep the Fabric prefix.
I have no idea what salt does in this context. Please explain it briefly in javadoc
I think salt just makes sure it doesn't spawn in the same place as another structure with same separation and spacing.

You can probably just (@see StructureConfig) to the vanilla class. I contributed some Javadocs to Yarn that explain its fields (this method just constructs a StructureConfig and passes it to the other overload of defaultConfig).
See here: https://github.com/FabricMC/yarn/blob/20w30a/mappings/net/minecraft/world/gen/chunk/StructureConfig.mapping#L27
I assume this feature is used if the generator type is a superflat type. I'd specify that in javadoc so people know what it does.
Assertion error please like the other accessor.
Maybe put getName in quotes like this: \"getName\"
I assume this is what causes the game to extend the walls of a villager house downwards to fill in air?
final and a private constructor since this is an impl class and has no real need to be constructed.

nodes.bodyText: I remember modmuss had to add something to biome api since nether chunk generator was initialized before mod init. Maybe validate this isn't called too early before chunk generator type is created?

No, it's safe in this case. The DEFAULT_STRUCTURES_CONFIGS set stores the set of configs which copied from StructureFeature.DEFAULT_STRUCTURES. This is so that when a mod registers a structure after the StructuresConfig has been created, the register method loops over all existing configs and adds the structure to it. If the structure is registered before this StructureConfig is created, then since it's added to StructureFeature.DEFAULT_STRUCTURES the StructureConfig will copy the structure into its list anyway.
Assertion error
Hmm, what does this module use from base api? If it doesn't use anything from it, you can omit this dependency.
